formattedAddress: 2063 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2063 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: Love this place! I went here for the first time based on other Google reviews and I was very satisfied with my experience. My stylist was Egypt and he did an excellent job with my hair. I came for a trim, steam treatment and silk press. As you can see in the photos my hair looks healthy and stylish. Everyone in the salon was great. From what I saw every woman who came in there left with great looking healthy hair. I already booked an appointment to come back for a conditioning treatment and perm rod set. I am so happy to find a great natural hair care salon! Also the prices were very reasonable and the staff is very knowledgeable on how to care for natural curly hair.

originalText.text: Paunice did a fabulous style on me and was awesome taking wonderful photos of my transition I wanted a mature yet sassy look. Paunice also gave me great hair advice to get and keep it healthy.My hair was damaged and her cutting skills brought LIFE to my hair. Other than the shop itself being a little cold(February storm) my experience was great!!

originalText.text: Very pleasant experience. The staff was kind and professional. I got crochet braids done, Egypt did a wonderful job. He was able to complete my hair within a couple of hours and style it nicely. The price was very reasonable. All prices are listed on the Vagaro booking website so there’s no surprises. I went in person to make my appointment cause I wanted to visit first. The place is clean and bright, two levels. They sell their own hair care products, I especially like the Growth Elixir. I’ve already scheduled my next appointment!

originalText.text:
I’ve been to NS and the Weave Lounge several times over the past 1.5yrs or so.  I go to them every couple months in between getting my crochet braids out so that I can get a good condition and trim. For the most part each time I’ve gone I’ve left with my hair feeling healthy.  But the last time I went in Feb to the Weave Lounge it was done by Briana Bayyan and she did an AMAZING job on my hair! She took her time and was super thorough; gave me a really good shampooing made sure it was super clean since I had just come out of braids; gave me an amazing trim and a beautiful silk press that lasted me two weeks! I was hoping to get her again but was disappointed to hear she no longer works there.  ☹ The shop was very clean and the atmosphere was professional.

Yesterday I went to Natural Sisters for a silk press and trim.  I was running late (struggling to find parking!) so I called to let them know and they were really nice about it - my stylist Tiffany S was very accommodating and I was truly grateful!!
This time I got another good trim but I feel like the silk press could’ve been a little hotter and the waves/curls could’ve been a little tighter because even though it looked good in the shop it did not hold up well to the humidity at all. It was already starting to frizz at my roots by the end of the day; and by the next day you couldn’t even tell I’d gotten my hair done. That’s disappointing considering I spent $110 for services. I hated spending all that time & money for a style that didn't last 2 days let alone a week.

originalText.text:
I've been using this hair salon for braiding for about 2 years now. I have NEVER been disappointed with my results.
They include a wash & dry with each hair appointment which you can decline if you wish, but they did a great job. Overall I highly recommend this braid and natural hair salon.
